texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Installing new hardware may mean that new kernel need to be loaded when your server boots up. There's a two step process to making a new initrd file:
texts.text: Installing new hardware may mean that new kernel need to be loaded when your server boots up. There's a two step process to making a new initrd file:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: First,  add the appropriate line to your /etc/modules.conf or /etc/modprobe.conf which corresponds to your new kernel module.
texts.text: First,  add the appropriate line to your /etc/modules.conf or /etc/modprobe.conf which corresponds to your new kernel module.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Next,  rebuild the initial ram disk after making a backup of the current one:
texts.text: Next,  rebuild the initial ram disk after making a backup of the current one:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Reboot the server now and make sure the new driver is loaded properly.
texts.text: Reboot the server now and make sure the new driver is loaded properly.
